task.title: Completing Selection Screens
task.shortdesc: Once you have completed Data Screens in Acme Eye, complete Selection Screens, including Executive Summary. Selection Screens allow you to make selections from Acme Eye database and include them in the document you are creating. Your selections tailor the document to your client's specific needs. Directions at the top of the screen help identify the type of selections you are making and their purpose. You make selections by checking a checkbox.

context.p: To complete the Executive Summary selection screen, follow these steps:

step.cmd: From the Document Outline, select Executive Summary.
step.info: The Executive Summary screen is displayed.
The Selections for Executive Summary screen is displayed.

step.cmd: Select the checkboxes for Lines of Business, Products, Customer Business Issues, and Differentiators that apply to your customer. Figure 5-1 shows a completed Executive Summary selections screen.

fig.title: Figure 5-1: Completed Executive Summary Selections Screen

example.note: For the Executive Summary, you can only select a maximum of five customer business issues. More than five customer business issues is too much for the customer to read.
